definition: clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.chinese: 克魯格曼是純粹的學院派。

sentences.english: In Chapter Three, the transition of the cultural formation of the "Academism" Northeast YangGe is analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 第三章分析“學院派”東北秧歌的文化形態變遷。

sentences.english: His work has received relatively little attention from academic critics.
sentences.chinese: 而相比較而言，學院派評論家很少關注他。

sentences.english: With many years of academic training, pop songs are just piece of cake for her.
sentences.chinese: 許多年的學院派訓練，演繹流行歌曲真是易如反掌。

sentences.english: Is there a conflict between industry and academia?
sentences.chinese: 難道是學院派和行業派的衝突嗎？

sentences.english: The modeling styles of orthodox academic school steadfastly construct the narrative space.
sentences.chinese: 正統學院派的造型形式，沉穩地構架起敘事空間場景。

sentences.english: It's easy for academic economists to preach patience.
sentences.chinese: 對於學院派經濟學家們而言，宣揚忍耐是很容易的。

sentences.english: “I’m kind of an old-school naturalist, ” she said.
sentences.chinese: “我有些像舊學院派的自然主義者，”她說。

sentences.english: The contemporary poet Ren Hongyuan's poetry is the typical example of poetic creation of the Chinese academism.
sentences.chinese: 當代詩人任洪淵的詩歌是中國學院派創作的一個典型。

definition: Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
